answers.answer: You should go see your doctor as soon as possible.  If you've had sex that can be a sign of an STD (even if you think you had safe sex condoms don't protect against everything).  If you haven't it could be a sign of another illness and I don't know all that much about diabetes to know if that plays a part.  the best thing to do is to get it checked so you can get treatment.  Whether it is serious or just an infected shaving cut or hair follicle, the doctor can prescribe medication to make it heal faster or treat the underlying illness.

question: I HAVE A BOIL ON THE VAGINAL AREA. IT IS CONTINUING TO DRAIN. I NOTICED IT ABOUT 3 WEEKS AGO. THERE IS STILL A HARDEN LUMP UNDER THE SKIN. I THOUGHT THE DRAINAGE HAD STOPPED, BUT I NOTICED IT 2 DAYS AGO. THERE WAS NEVER ANY REAL PAIN. ONLY FROM WHEN I HAVE PUT PRESSUE ON IT FOR A TIME. IT IS LOCATED CLOSER TO THE OUTER PARTS OF THE VAGINAL WALL NEARER TO THE GROIN AREA. i AM NOT SURE WHAT I SHOULD PUT ON IT EITHER.
title: diabetic with a boil
